oai_dc:dc.dc:title: REDUCTION OF WAVE FORCES AND OVERTOPPING BY SUBMERGED STRUCTURES IN FRONT OF A VERTICAL BREAKWATER
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Madrigal, B. Gonzalez
Prud'Homme, J. Olivares
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: breakwater
wave force
force reduction
overtopping
submerged structure
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper describes some of the results obtained from e. series of model tests to measure wave forces and overtopping in a vertical breakwater located in a surf zone. The aim of the tests was to better design conditions; using submerged structures. With the sections proposed in this study, it is possible to achieve a considerable reduction in wave forcas and overtopping on vertical breakwaters.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 22 (1990): Proceedings of 22nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Delft, The Netherlands, 1990.
